comments:
I create a site from the 20020508 zip using the repackager utility. Start 
Eclipse, navigate to the site (on My Computer), select the PDE feature, select 
[Update].

The following appears on console:

Unhandled exception caught in event loop.

The feature.xml contains <imports> without versions. This is allowed (is 
#IMPLIED in the DTD, the semantics are those of <import> plugin.xml ... ie. if 
no version is supplied, any version will do)

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<feature
      id="org.eclipse.pde"
      label="%featureName"
      version="1.9.0.200205081411"
      provider-name="%providerName">

   <requires>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ant.core"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.jdt.core"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.update.core"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.resources"/>
      <import plugin="org.apache.xerces"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.runtime"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ui"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.jdt.ui"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.debug.core"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.jdt.launching"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ant.ui"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.debug.ui"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.update.ui.forms"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.pde"/>
   </requires>

   <plugin id="org.eclipse.pde" version="1.9.0.v20020508"/>

   <plugin
         id="org.eclipse.pde.build"
         download-size="0"
         install-size="0"
         version="1.9.0.v20020508">
   </plugin>

   <plugin
         id="org.eclipse.pde.core"
         download-size="0"
         install-size="0"
         version="1.9.0.v20020508">
   </plugin>

   <plugin
         id="org.eclipse.pde.runtime"
         download-size="0"
         install-size="0"
         version="1.9.0.v20020508">
   </plugin>

   <plugin
         id="org.eclipse.pde.ui"
         download-size="0"
         install-size="0"
         version="1.9.0.v20020508">
   </plugin>

</feature>

When no versionis found we now set the version to 0.0.0
Pass to UI team as the same testcase now fails because the plugins are not found
on the file system.
UI should check if 0.0.0 is the version and if so, accept any version on the
file system

The semantics in terms of matching of <import> prereqs in feature.xml are the 
same as in plugin.xml (it's written that way in the spec). So if you get an 
<import> without a version and match rule, it should match any version of the 
referenced plugin. Effectively, it is the same as saying

<import plugin="my.plugin" version="0.0.0" match="greaterOrEqual"/>

If you only set the version to "0.0.0" the default match rule is "equivalent" 
(as in plugin.xml) and this will only find plugins with versions "0.0.*"
So what is the conclusion: what should UI do exactly?

We'll fix in import model ...

Case 1: no version, no match --> version="0.0.0" match="greaterThanOrEqual"
Case 2: no version, but match --> ignore match, treat as case 1
Case 3: version, but no match --> match defaults to "compatible"
Case 4: version and match --> use as specified
*** Bug 15751 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
